Question
========

In a class there are 30 students, three of whom are left-handed. Suppose that you want to randomly choose two of the 30 students, what is the probability that you will choose a second left-handed student, given that the first student is also left-handed?

Answerlist
----------

* 1/30
* 2/30
* 1/29
* 2/29

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 1/30: Incorrect
* 2/30: Incorrect
* 1/29: Incorrect
* 2/29: Correct
